--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "John Arrowwood" <jarrowwx@h...> wrote:
> After almost 7 thousand generations, the champion topology only 
had 2 hidden 
> nodes.  One had two connections, one had about 10.  At this rate, 
I'll be 
> old and gray before it gets anywhere.
> 
> Any ideas how to speed up the process of adding topology without 
losing the 
> ability to optimize and thoroughly evaluate those topologies?

You may want to make the "add-structure" mutation rates variable.  
You can have a rule that says, "If this species has not improved in 
X generations, then up the structural mutation rate ONLY IN THIS 
SPECIES by some small increment."  That way, structure will add 
increasingly fast in species that are stagnating.  You probably also 
should have a cap on how fast it can get so it doesn't get out of 
hand.

ken
